articles.title: Budget 2026: Sustaining India’s growth depends on consumption, investment, and fiscal consolidation
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: As we move into 2026, India's economic landscape is flourishing with notable strides in both manufacturing and services. The dual engine of rising private consumption and investment is propelling this success, leading experts to amend their growth predictions positively.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026 to be presented on February 1, Sunday
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget on February 1, 2026. Parliament will convene for the Budget session on January 28, 2026. The session will conclude on April 2, 2026. The President will address a joint sitting on the opening day. This marks a significant event for the nation's financial planning.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Govt should refrain from hiking income tax surcharge on super-rich, experts say
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Tax experts advise the government against increasing income tax surcharges on the super-rich or reintroducing wealth tax in the upcoming budget. Such measures could prompt high-income earners to relocate to low-tax jurisdictions, potentially impacting job creation and investment. Experts suggest focusing on administrative efficiency and existing tax enforcement.

articles.title: Govt to achieve fiscal deficit target of 4.4% in FY26, may even better it: PwC
articles.summary: India is poised to meet its fiscal deficit target of 4.4 percent of GDP for FY26. Experts suggest the government may even surpass this goal, sending a positive message to international investors about fiscal discipline. Despite a revised nominal GDP growth forecast, absolute figures align with budget estimates. This achievement is expected to bolster confidence in India's economic management.

articles.title: CII calls for value unlocking of PSUs through fast-tracking privatisation

CII proposes a demand-driven selection process, a three-year privatization pipeline, and an institutional framework to expedite disinvestment and unlock significant resources for national development.

articles.title: Income tax return filing: Here's what happens if you miss the ITR deadline
articles.summary: Missing the Income Tax Return filing deadline doesn’t end your tax obligation, but it can make it more expensive and restrictive. From late filing fees and interest charges to limits on refunds and loss carry-forward, this photo story breaks down what changes when you file late and why timing matters as much as accuracy.

संभावित परिणाम: भारत यात्रा (12-13 जनवरी, 2026) पर जर्मनी के चांसलर
आयुर्वेद के मानकीकरण पर राष्ट्रीय कार्यशाला आयोजित, गुणवत्ता और वैश्विक भरोसा बढ़ाने के लिए सहयोग पर बल
विकसित भारत यंग लीडर्स डायलॉग 2026 में केंद्रीय मंत्री शिवराज सिंह चौहान का युवा नेतृत्व से संवाद
उपराष्ट्रपति श्री सी.पी. राधाकृष्णन ने जवाहरलाल नेहरू विश्वविद्यालय के 9वें दीक्षांत समारोह को संबोधित किया; युवाओं से बौद्धिक अखंडता और राष्ट्र निर्माण की भावना बनाए रखने की अपील की
पारादीप बंदरगाह पर 25वें अखिल भारतीय प्रमुख पत्तन सांस्कृतिक सम्मेलन 2025-26 का भव्य समापन
डीआरडीओ ने चलाएमान लक्ष्य के विरुद्ध उच्चतम आक्रमण क्षमता वाली मानव-चालित एंटी-टैंक गाइडेड मिसाइल का सफल उड़ान परीक्षण किया

केंद्रीय मत्स्य पालन, पशुपालन और डेयरी मंत्री “सामुद्रिक खाद्य सुरक्षा: दक्षिण-पूर्व एशिया (सीईए) का सामुद्रिक भविष्य” पर आयोजित द्वित्तीय वैश्विक शिखर सम्मेलन में भाग लेने के लिए इज़राइल का दौरा करेंगे
छत्तीसगढ़ से कृषि और प्रसंस्कृत खाद्य पदार्थों के निर्यात को बढ़ावा देने के लिए एपीडा ने रायपुर में क्षेत्रीय कार्यालय का उद्घाटन किया
जर्मनी के चांसलर फ्रेडरिक मर्ज़ के साथ संयुक्त प्रेस कॉन्फ्रेंस के दौरान प्रधानमंत्री के भाषण मूल पाठ
विशेषज्ञों ने भारत की औषधीय पौधों की आपूर्ति श्रृंखला को सुदृढ़ करने के लिए एआई-सक्षम फार्म-गेट गुणवत्ता और ट्रेसिएबिलिटी की मांग की
उपराष्ट्रपति श्री सी.पी. राधाकृष्णन ने स्वामी विवेकानंद की जयंती पर उन्हें श्रद्धांजलि अर्पित की
केन्द्रीय गृह एवं सहकारिता मंत्री श्री अमित शाह ने स्वामी विवेकानंद जी की जयंती पर उन्हें श्रद्धापूर्वक नमन किया तथा समस्त देशवासियों को ‘राष्ट्रीय युवा दिवस’ की शुभकामनाएँ दी
तकनीकी हिंदी संगोष्ठी ‘अभ्युदय-3’ में विज्ञान और प्रौद्योगिकी के हाल के विकास और उनके सामाजिक अंतर्संबंधों पर प्रस्तुतियां दी गईं
प्रधानमंत्री ने स्वामी विवेकानंद को उनकी जयंती पर श्रद्धांजलि अर्पित की
प्रधानमंत्री ने स्वामी विवेकानंद के युवा शक्ति पर आधारित विश्वास को रेखांकित करते हुए संस्कृत सुभाषितम साझा किया
वित्त वर्ष 2013-14 में 95.79 लाख टन मछली उत्पादन की तुलना में वित्त वर्ष 2024-25 में मछली उत्पादन बढ़कर 197.75 लाख टन हो गया है, जो 106 प्रतिशत की तेज वृद्धि है
श्री धर्मेंद्र प्रधान ने नई दिल्ली विश्व पुस्तक मेले 2026 में पीएम-युवा 3.0 लेखकों से बातचीत की
इलेक्ट्रॉनिक्स एवं सूचना प्रौद्योगिकी मंत्रालय सुरक्षा मानकों पर उद्योग के निरंतर सहयोग के साथ सुरक्षा और संरक्षा आवश्यकताओं पर हितधारकों के साथ निरंतर संपर्क में
प्रधानमंत्री ने सोमनाथ स्वाभिमान पर्व की झलकियाँ साझा कीं

articles.summary: Reserve Bank of India introduced the Foreign Exchange Management (Guarantees) Regulations, 2026, replacing the 2000 framework. They outline prohibitions, exemptions, conditions for acting as surety or principal debtor, and reporting requirements. articles.title: TREADS: Transboundary Rivers, Ecologies & Development Studies

We pursue our interests in this generic sense of transboundary political spaces, at present focused primarily on transboundary river water governance.

She highlights the unpopularity of civil courts, the systemic nature of the problem and argues that real change lies not in blaming individuals but in pursuing institutional reforms to strengthen our civil courts.

articles.title: Set the guardrails for AI use in courtrooms
articles.summary: In July this year, the Kerala High Court published a set of guidelines for Artificial Intelligence (AI) use by the district judiciary (“Policy Regarding Use of Artificial Intelligence Tools in District Judiciary”). articles.title: Why ICAI’s audit limit is misguided and outdated

articles.title: Mapping Judicial Time: A Two-by-Two Framework for Categorising Listings
articles.summary: In this blog post, Gokul Krishnan R proposes a novel two-by-two framework for categorising case listings in Indian trial courts. The framework classifies listings based on their nature (procedural or substantive) and their effectiveness in advancing cases toward resolution. This approach provides a nuanced understanding of judicial time utilisation, moving beyond traditional definitions of "effective hearing".

articles.title: Deduction Allowed Since Form 10CCB Audit Report Filed Before Processing of Return
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that a deduction cannot be disallowed merely due to delayed filing of Form 10CCB when it was available before processing. Procedural delay does not defeat a valid deduction claim. The post Deduction Allowed Since Form 10CCB Audit Report Filed Before Processing of Return appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Counterfeit Goods Can’t Be Treated as Branded; Customs Value Enhancement Set Aside
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that transaction value could not be rejected without evidence or proper application of valuation rules. Arbitrary enhancement and penalties were quashed for lack of comparables and proof of undervaluation. The post Counterfeit Goods Can’t Be Treated as Branded; Customs Value Enhancement Set Aside appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Notice by Wrong Officer Invalid, Entire Assessment Set Aside
articles.summary: Since the statutory notice under section 143(2) was issued by a non-jurisdictional officer, the assessment collapsed. The ruling affirms that valid notice by the competent authority is a sine qua non. The post Notice by Wrong Officer Invalid, Entire Assessment Set Aside appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Composite GST Assessment Across Multiple Years Invalid: AP HC
articles.summary: The court ruled that a single assessment covering several tax periods violates GST provisions. Orders were set aside with liberty to initiate fresh, year-wise proceedings. The post Composite GST Assessment Across Multiple Years Invalid: AP HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: NCLAT Refuses to Entertain Appeal as No Grounds Made Out but Keeps Legal Remedies Intact
articles.summary: The appellate tribunal declined to entertain the appeal citing absence of grounds. It clarified that the impugned order would not prevent the appellant from raising all legal pleas in any future proceedings. The post NCLAT Refuses to Entertain Appeal as No Grounds Made Out but Keeps Legal Remedies Intact appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Assessment Quashed for Exceeding Limited Scrutiny Jurisdiction
articles.summary: The Tribunal ruled that additions made on issues beyond limited scrutiny were without authority since proper conversion to complete scrutiny was not followed. The key takeaway is that violating CBDT instructions renders the entire assessment void. The post Assessment Quashed for Exceeding Limited Scrutiny Jurisdiction appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Madras HC Set Aside GST DRC-07 Orders for Fresh Decision Subject to Pre-Deposit
articles.summary: The High Court remitted GST DRC-07 orders after noting that show cause notices were not replied to. Relief was granted subject to a 10% pre-deposit and filing of consolidated replies. The post Madras HC Set Aside GST DRC-07 Orders for Fresh Decision Subject to Pre-Deposit appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Allahabad HC Upheld Section 74 GST Notice Due to Prima Facie Satisfaction of Fraud
articles.summary: The High Court refused to quash a GST show cause notice where the authority had formed prima facie satisfaction of fraudulent ITC availment. The ruling affirms limited judicial interference at the notice stage. The post Allahabad HC Upheld Section 74 GST Notice Due to Prima Facie Satisfaction of Fraud appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Estimated Profit Rejected as Audited Books Showed Reasonable Margin
articles.summary: The Tribunal ruled that estimating higher profit without rejecting audited books or finding major defects is impermissible. The declared 7% margin was accepted as reasonable, emphasizing limits on ad-hoc profit estimation. The post Estimated Profit Rejected as Audited Books Showed Reasonable Margin appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Mandatory Levy of Service Charge by Restaurants is illegal: Govt
articles.summary: Authorities have clarified that compulsory service charges violate consumer law, reaffirming that tips must be voluntary and cannot be added by default to bills. The post Mandatory Levy of Service Charge by Restaurants is illegal: Govt appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: DRAT Dismisses Appeal: Bill Acceptors Liable Jointly with Borrower; Ex-Parte DRT Decree Upheld
articles.summary: The appellate tribunal upheld joint liability where accepted bills remained unpaid and the appellants failed to rebut the bank’s evidence. The ruling confirms that unchallenged documentary claims can sustain recovery orders. The post DRAT Dismisses Appeal: Bill Acceptors Liable Jointly with Borrower; Ex-Parte DRT Decree Upheld appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Goods to Be Released Under GST S.129 Despite Delay in Penalty Payment as No Confiscation Action Taken: AP HC
articles.summary: High Court held that goods and conveyance detained under GST must be released once penalty is paid, where authorities failed to initiate confiscation after statutory period. Mere delay in payment did not justify continued detention. The post Goods to Be Released Under GST S.129 Despite Delay in Penalty Payment as No Confiscation Action Taken: AP HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: DEPB Not Excludable from Gross Profit for Business Income; ITAT Deletes Addition
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that DEPB income forms part of operating export income and cannot be excluded from turnover merely on a different view. Revision under section 263 was found unjustified where the original assessment involved due application of mind. The post DEPB Not Excludable from Gross Profit for Business Income; ITAT Deletes Addition appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Patna HC reduces Excise Penalty from 90% to 10% as Disproportionate to Insured Value
articles.summary: The court found that a penalty amounting to nearly 90% of the vehicle’s insured value was excessive. It ruled that only the minimum penalty under the excise rules was justified. The post Patna HC reduces Excise Penalty from 90% to 10% as Disproportionate to Insured Value appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Wrong Classification Alone Insufficient to Invoke Customs Section 111(o) Without Exemption Breach
articles.summary: The Tribunal upheld reclassification and duty recovery but ruled that section 111(o) applies only where exemption conditions are breached. Mere ineligibility to exemption due to wrong classification cannot justify confiscation or penalty. The post Wrong Classification Alone Insufficient to Invoke Customs Section 111(o) Without Exemption Breach appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: GST Penalty Notice Set Aside for Lack of Clear Section 122 Jurisdiction: AP HC
articles.summary: The High Court quashed a penalty show cause notice issued under Section 122, holding that jurisdiction cannot be assumed merely on the basis of a general notification. Fresh proceedings were permitted in accordance with law. The post GST Penalty Notice Set Aside for Lack of Clear Section 122 Jurisdiction: AP HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Income Tax Refund Adjustment Barred When Tax Demand Stayed U/s. 220(6): Calcutta HC
articles.summary: The High Court held that refunds cannot be adjusted against a demand already stayed by the Assessing Officer. It directed refund of amounts adjusted despite the assessee being treated as not in default. The post Income Tax Refund Adjustment Barred When Tax Demand Stayed U/s. 220(6): Calcutta HC appeared first on TaxGuru .
