articles.summary: As Visakhapatnam readies a mega airport, the Andhra Pradesh government has revived its shelved Dagadarthi project, aiming to boost cargo and connectivity on the south coast.

articles.title: Techno Paints to raise Rs 500 cr through IPO in FY27, appoints Sachin Tendulkar as brand ambassador
articles.summary: Hyderabad, Jan 10 (PTI) Techno Paints and Chemicals is planning to raise Rs 500 crore through an IPO in the next financial year, company sources said on Saturday. Sachin Tendulkar has been appointed as the brand ambassador of the paint manufacturer for three years, a move expected to help the company expand across the country. [ ]

articles.title: India’s growth story rests on stability, reforms & strategic self-reliance: Shaktikanta Das
articles.summary: Former RBI governor says India is now expected to remain the fastest-growing major economy; self-reliance gives India economic resilience and foreign policy autonomy.

articles.title: Delhi govt hikes allocations for transport, education, urban development in 2025-26
articles.summary: New Delhi, Jan 9 (PTI) The Delhi government has revised its budget allocations from Rs 28,115 crore to Rs 30,248 crore to boost major projects in urban development, transport, education and Yamuna rejuvenation segments. Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, who holds the Finance portfolio in the Delhi government, presented supplementary demands for grants for the 2025-26 [ ]

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO subscribed 8.1 times on Day 1
articles.summary: Kolkata, Jan 9 (PTI) The initial public offering of Bharat Coking Coal Limited was subscribed 8.09 times on the first day of bidding on Friday, driven by strong demand from retail, non-institutional and existing shareholder investor categories. The issue received bids for 2,80,61,36,400 equity shares against the offer size of 34,69,46,500 shares, according to data [ ]

articles.title: Global economic growth to slow in 2026 as Trump’s tariffs bite, UN says
articles.summary: The global economy is forecast to expand 2.7% this year, down from an estimated 2.8% in 2025. Growth is expected to go back up to 2.9% by 2027.

articles.title: Texmaco Rail bags Rs 64-cr wagon order from APL Logistics Vascor Automotive
articles.summary: Kolkata, Jan 9 (PTI) Texmaco Rail   Engineering Ltd on Friday said it has secured a purchase order worth Rs 64 crore from APL Logistics Vascor Automotive for manufacture and supply of specialised freight wagons. The order involves the supply of rakes of ACT-1 wagons along with brake vans of the BVCM type, strengthening Texmaco [ ]

articles.title: Forex reserves drop by USD 9.80 bln to USD 686.80 bln
articles.summary: Mumbai, Jan 9 (PTI) India s forex reserves dropped by USD 9.809 billion to USD 686.801 billion in the week to January 2, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said on Friday. In the previous reporting week, the forex reserves had jumped by USD 3.293 billion to USD 696.61 billion. For the week ended January 2, [ ]

articles.title: Vi to pay govt Rs 1,144 cr in 10 yrs for Rs 87,000 cr AGR dues, rest from Mar 2036 onwards
articles.summary: New Delhi, Jan 9 (PTI) Beleaguered telecom operator Vodafone Idea will pay the government Rs 1,144 crore over period of next 10 years and rest of the adjusted gross revenue dues, frozen at Rs 87,695 crore by the union cabinet, from March 2036 onwards, the company said on Friday. The government has frozen AGR dues [ ]

articles.title: Imbibe spirit of regulations, just don’t follow tick-box based compliance culture: RBI guv to REs
articles.summary: Mumbai, Jan 9 (PTI) Financial institutions need to imbibe the spirit of regulations, rather than just  tick-box-based compliance culture , Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra said on Friday as he pitched for a collaborative approach to curb digital frauds. Addressing the Third Annual Global Conference of the College of Supervisors, the governor said while digital channels [ ]

articles.title: How reels, shorts & TikTok clips can reduce focus
articles.summary: Research links fast-paced short-form video use with weaker attention, poor sleep and higher anxiety in young users.

articles.title: Back to original in 2 years: Patients gain weight faster coming off obesity drugs than after a diet
articles.summary: It means drugs alone may not be sufficient for long-term weight control, the University of Oxford researchers said.

articles.title: Why the real weight gain struggle begins before menopause
articles.summary: Most women expect the weight struggle to begin after menopause. But research suggests the real metabolic shift happens years earlier.

articles.title: Our ancestors never needed dental braces. Here is why
articles.summary: The image of ancient people sporting gold and catgut braces is certainly appealing and dramatic, but it doesn’t match the evidence.

articles.title: Muscle tissue damage, hormone imbalances: Hard workouts can lead to overtraining syndrome
articles.summary: Stressing the body repeatedly without sufficient rest and recovery can flip progress. It can also leave you more susceptible to stress fractures, chronic tendonitis and other overuse injuries.

articles.title: Heavy screen time for young children ‘altered brain networks’, linked to teen anxiety, research finds
articles.summary: The study, published in The Lancet’s eBioMedicine open access journal, tracked 168 children for more than a decade and conducted brain scans on them at three time points.

articles.title: Weight-loss drugs are changing. Here’s what to know about GLP-1s
articles.summary: While the drugs have become spectacularly popular, their high prices, along with spotty insurance coverage, have left them out of reach for many. Pills, which will be cheaper, might change that.

articles.title: Should you get screened for breast cancer annually? New study by US scientists suggests better approach
articles.summary: US researchers conducted a trial of over 28,000 women aged 40-74 to find an effective way of distributing breast cancer screening resources. Results published in JAMA on 12 Dec.

articles.title: They teach what textbooks can’t: Rise of professors of practice in India & why universities want them
articles.summary: From boardrooms to lecture halls, experienced professionals are closing the industry-academia gap. Their appointments are for fixed terms, and don't affect regular recruitment.

articles.title: Will have to start from scratch, say medical students after brand new college in Jammu shuts abruptly
articles.summary: Barely months after classes began, MBBS students at Vaishno Devi institute leave as NMC revokes permit amidst protests by Hindu outfits over admission of Muslim students.

articles.title: Reversing brain drain: Modi govt has a ‘scheme’ up its sleeve to get back top Indian-origin researchers
articles.summary: Proposal was presented during IIT Council meeting, with understanding initiative will be launched soon. It will focus on 14 priority sectors including semiconductors   AI.

articles.title: On the cards at IITs: Reforms in MTech & PhD programmes, making JEE-Advanced ‘more student friendly’
articles.summary: IIT Kanpur to outline roadmap to transition JEE Advanced to adaptive testing, which dynamically adjusts question difficulty to better assess student skills while reducing stress.

articles.title: Citing zero applicants, Centre encourages scholars from 4 Northeast states to opt for IKS internship
articles.summary: The six-month initiative supports selected projects with interns receiving a monthly fellowship of Rs 10,000. These six states, UT were chosen after low participation.

articles.title: Amid protests, Centre sends Tezpur University V-C on leave, forms panel to probe ‘irregularities’
articles.summary: The 3-member committee will review the situation at the university, including allegations against V-C Shambu Nath Singh. Protests have been going on since late September.

articles.title: Born in a lab, Indian Statistical Institute helped shape new India. A bill intends to alter its future
articles.summary: Section of faculty, students and alumni oppose MoSPI's draft Bill that seeks to replace Indian Statistical Institute's elected Governing Council with government-nominated board.

articles.title: Centre backs Andhra’s PPP push to build new medical colleges—the model & political row over it
articles.summary: In a letter to Andhra Pradesh's medical   health minister last month, JP Nadda wrote that states, ‘by strategically adopting PPP models’, could accelerate healthcare reforms.

articles.title: Email ID ‘abc@gmail’, ‘111111’ as bank A/C—CAG flags gaps in Modi govt’s flagship upskilling scheme
articles.summary: Audit finds violations in age and education criteria, duplicate photos, unspent funds, and shut training centres in states surveyed; report tabled in Parliament.

articles.title: From new year, NTA to verify candidates in NEET, JEE & other entrance exams with facial recognition
articles.summary: Aadhaar card will be used for verification. Decision taken after a small trial at some exam centres for NEET-UG this year.

articles.title: Jamia suspends professor over question on ‘atrocities against Muslims in India’ in semester exam paper
articles.summary: New Delhi: Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) has suspended a professor from its department of social work over a question he set on “atrocities against Muslims in India  in a semester exam paper. According to university officials, there were complaints over a question in the BA (Hons) Social Work first-semester examination held earlier this week in [ ]

articles.title: The IIM (under)grad is born: India’s B-schools are reinventing themselves & it’s a ‘win-win’
articles.summary: Over the last two years, several IIMs have expanded beyond their flagship MBA programmes by launching undergraduate courses, including one of the older institutes, IIM Bangalore.

articles.title: ‘Brain drain’ is real: For every 1 foreign student, 25 Indians go abroad for studies, says NITI Aayog
articles.summary: Outmigration of skilled students hampers innovation   knowledge creation as well as increases dependency on foreign tech, it asserts, calling for 'internationalisation at home'.

articles.title: UGC tells universities to prevent entry of stray dogs in campus, calls for ’round-the-clock vigil’
articles.summary: Direction is in line with SC's 7 November order asking all states/UTs and Centre to secure educational institutions and other public places from stray canines, says UGC.

articles.title: Recognition, funding, autonomy. Educationists divided over single higher education regulator Bill
articles.summary: Vikshit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill proposes setting up an overarching higher education commission along with 3 councils for regulation, accreditation   standards of universities.

articles.title: Dharmendra Pradhan defends higher education overhaul Bill—‘no threat to autonomy of states’
articles.summary: Union Minister’s remarks come after Oppn parties raise concerns about ‘excessive centralisation’ of higher education in India. Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill referred to JPC.

articles.title: 1 regulator, 3 councils: Inside Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill for higher education overhaul
articles.summary: Modi govt is set to introduce bill that proposes umbrella body for higher education, councils for regulation, accreditation. It will be headed by a chairperson appointed by the President.

articles.title: HCL Technologies Q3 Results: Cons PAT falls 11% YoY to Rs 4,076 crore, revenue rises 13%; Rs 12 per share dividend declared
articles.summary: HCL Tech Q3 Results: HCL Technologies on Monday reported an 11% YoY fall in its December quarter consolidated net profit at Rs 4,076 crore compared to Rs 4,591 crore reported in the year ago period. The profit after tax (PAT) is attributable to the owners of the company.

articles.title: Infra.Market FY25 revenue jumps 27% to Rs 18,472 crore, profit falls 42%
articles.summary: Infra.Market reported strong topline growth in FY25, with revenue rising sharply year-on-year, even as profitability weakened. Higher costs across materials, staffing and finance dragged net profit down significantly. The Mumbai-based construction materials platform has filed confidentially for a Rs 5,000-crore IPO and was last valued at about $2.8 billion.

articles.title: TCS Q3 Results: Cons PAT falls 14% YoY to Rs 10,657 crore, but revenue rises 5%
articles.summary: TCS Q3 Results: Revenue from operations in Q3FY26 rose 5% year-on-year to Rs 67,087 crore, up from Rs 63,973 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous financial year.

articles.title: India to be invited to join US-led AI initiative
articles.summary: India will be invited next month to join a new US-led initiative aimed at securing AI supply chains, the new US ambassador to New Delhi said Monday. Dubbed the "Pax Silica", after the Latin terms for peace and silicon, the alliance aims to secure supply chains of key components independent of China.

articles.title: Demand for AI, tech experts pushes UK financial sector vacancies up 12%, recruiter says
articles.summary: The year-on-year increase happened despite a slowdown in the fourth quarter, as volatility in global markets and uncertainty about the government's November ​budget prompted caution in hiring ​managers, Morgan McKinley's London Employment Monitor, ‌a ‍quarterly survey of financial services vacancies, ‍showed.

articles.title: Account suspended: X shelves iconic @twitter handle
articles.summary: Users who attempt to access the @Twitter handle are now greeted with the message "Account Suspended", noting that the account violated X's rules. Screenshots popped up late Friday, with memes and jokes about the platform policing its own past.

articles.title: What the Grok controversy reveals about NSFW content from AI chatbots
articles.summary: Grok is facing serious scrutiny after previously enabling users to generate sexually explicit visual content involving real individuals, raising concerns around personal safety, dignity, privacy, and consent. While Elon Musk-owned xAI has since rolled back access, restricting image and video generation to its paid subscribers, the incident has sparked a larger question about AI chatbots generating sexually explicit content.

articles.title: Zepto claims Hyderabad accident victim was not its delivery partner
articles.summary: The incident occurred in the city's Mehdipatnam police limits, where a rider named Abhishek, a native of Shekpet, died after his two-wheeler collided with a bus. Police officials said that the victim worked as a delivery rider for Zepto, prompting the Gig Workers’ Union to demand justice and compensation for the family.

articles.title: Meta urges Australia to change teen social media ban
articles.summary: Tech giant Meta urged Australia on Monday to rethink its world-first social media ban for under-16s, while reporting that it has blocked more than 544,000 accounts under the new law. Australia has required big platforms including Meta, TikTok and YouTube to stop underage users from holding accounts since the legislation came into force on December 10 last year.

articles.title: Google's Gemini seeks edge in AI for online shopping
articles.summary: Google on Sunday unveiled a new iteration of its professional Gemini AI suite geared toward online retail, seeking to create seamless interactions for shoppers from product searches to customer service. Walmart said the tool would help it offer products best suited to its customers' needs, more regularly converting product searches into sales.

articles.title: Mixed Q3 awaits Indian ER&D companies navigating auto sector headwinds
articles.summary: Indian engineering service firms like Tata Elxsi, KPIT and LTTS are set for a mixed Q3 due to weak auto demand, though rising R D in EVs and hybrids offers support. Analysts expect modest 1–2.8% revenue growth, with EU-focused companies benefiting more than US-exposed peers. These firms' FY26 growth could reach 15–20%.

articles.title: Anti-money laundering norms up crypto compliance bar
articles.summary: India’s financial intelligence unit has tightened anti-money laundering rules for crypto firms, increasing compliance and security obligations. Mandatory registration, audits and stricter KYC norms may raise costs and slow new entrants. While this could reduce misuse and improve trust, smaller platforms may struggle under heavier regulatory pressure.

articles.title: IT hardware distributor Mitsumi Distribution eyes Rs 1,000 crore India play
articles.summary: Mitsumi Distribution is entering India with a Rs 700–1,000 crore investment over three years to build infrastructure, inventory and logistics. The company will target underpenetrated tier-II to tier-IV cities, avoiding saturated metro markets. Operations have begun in Mumbai, Delhi and Bengaluru, with plans to expand rapidly across smaller cities.

articles.title: IT ministry takes up communications device safety issue; mobile phone players say routine consultation
articles.summary: The IT ministry has taken over discussions on mobile phone and communication device safety from the telecom department under the ITSAR framework. Industry sources say this is a routine consultation with no new mandates. Talks focus on standards for software updates and device source code, ensuring transparent engagement with manufacturers.

articles.title: India tightens crypto noose: Live selfies, geo-tagging now mandatory for users
articles.summary: India has tightened rules for cryptocurrency exchanges, introducing tougher AML and KYC checks. Users must complete live selfie verification, location tracking and enhanced identity checks, while risky tokens and ICOs are discouraged. Exchanges must monitor high-risk clients closely and keep detailed records to combat money laundering and terrorism financing risks.

articles.title: India proposes forcing smartphone makers to give source code in security overhaul: Report
articles.summary: India is reportedly proposing new security rules for smartphones. These rules include sharing source code and making software changes. Tech companies like Apple and Samsung are opposing these measures. They argue the requirements lack global precedent and risk revealing proprietary information.

articles.title: Meta denies data breach of 17.5 million users; asks users to ignore password reset emails
articles.summary: In 2021, Facebook, another Meta company, reported that data of over 350 million users had been exposed from publicly accessible profiles but not breached. Data breaches at other major social media platforms, X and LinkedIn, were reported in 2018 and 2021, impacting billions of users.

articles.title: Under EU scrutiny, Musk vows to release X’s algorithm code every four weeks
articles.summary: This is not the first time X has promised to make its algorithms open source. Elon Musk had made similar commitments in 2022 and 2023. However, the latest publicly available update to its recommendation code dates back to March 2023.

articles.title: ITAT rejects Binny Bansal's 'non-resident' status claim
articles.summary: The Bengaluru bench of the Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) has rejected Flipkart co-founder Binny Bansal's claim of non-resident status for assessment year 2020-21, thereby denying him the benefit of the India-Singapore Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement (DTAA).

articles.title: The man who could be Apple's next CEO
articles.summary: Around 2018, Apple weighed adding costly laser tech to iPhones, highlighting the cautious leadership style of hardware chief John Ternus. Now seen as a leading successor to CEO Tim Cook, Ternus embodies Apple’s incremental, profit-focused approach amid succession planning and innovation challenges.

articles.title: Cloudflare threatens Olympic services over piracy fine
articles.summary: US internet company Cloudflare has threatened to pull its services in Italy, including for the Winter Olympics, after being fined 14 million euros ($16 million) for failing to tackle online piracy.

articles.title: Uber Eats driver criticises Tesla Model Y; promotes 1999 Fiat in viral exchange
articles.summary: The driver reportedly told the customer that the two-decade-old Fiat was “built to last” and cheaper to maintain. The post drew mixed reactions, with some users backing the claim and joking that older European models often outlast modern cars because of their mechanical simplicity, while others defended Tesla’s Model Y for its energy efficiency and advanced technology. The debate comes as Tesla has lost its position as the world’s largest EV maker, after sales fell for a second straight year, an

articles.title: Google founders Larry Page, Sergey Brin pull back from California over wealth tax fears
articles.summary: Google founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin are reducing their California business presence, moving companies to Nevada and buying property elsewhere, amid concern over a proposed California wealth tax on billionaires. The measure has sparked debate, with tech leaders warning it could drive capital and innovation out of Silicon Valley.

articles.title: TN's iTNT Hub inks pact with XeedQ GmbH for quantum computing programmes
articles.summary: The programme will be anchored by the Tamil Nadu Technology Hub (iTNT), a public–private initiative supported by the TN government that is an emerging and deeptech innovation network that works closely with academic institutions, startups, and research communities across the state. XeedQ GmbH will provide the remote access, quantum hardware, technical expertise, and learning support as part of this engagement.

articles.title: FCC approves SpaceX plan to deploy an additional 7,500 Starlink satellites
articles.summary: The agency said the additional satellites will provide direct-to-cell connectivity outside the United States and supplemental U.S. coverage, which will allow for next-generation mobile services as well as internet speeds of up to 1 gigabit per second.

articles.title: Chinese AI unicorn MiniMax soars 109% in Hong Kong debut
articles.summary: Shares in Chinese AI startup MiniMax soared 109% as it went public in Hong Kong on Friday, raising US$619 million in a sign that strong investor demand is rewarding the country's rapidly developing sector. Friday's shares performance shows investors have a "strong appetite for China's tech sector and the AI story", Gary Ng, senior economist at Natixis Corporate and Investment Banking, told AFP. The whole AI sector is still at an early stage of development, which requires massive investment, he s

articles.title: Grok limits image generation to paid users; not enough, says govt
articles.summary: MeitY's concernThe issue will remain if X continues to allow the generation, hosting, uploading or sharing of obscene and illegal content that hurts the privacy and dignity of our citizens, especially women and children, in any manner

articles.title: Democratic senators demand Apple, Google take X and Grok off app stores over sexual images: Report
articles.summary: Three Democratic ⁠US senators are ‌calling ‌on Apple and ‌Alphabet's Google to remove X and Grok ​from ​their respective ‌app ‍stores ‍over the spread of ‌nonconsensual sexual images of women and ‍minors on ‍the ⁠platforms, ⁠NBC News reported Friday.

articles.title: L&T Semiconductor Technologies forays into cellular IoT module business
articles.summary: The first module, powered by Qualcomm, will be produced in collaboration with Indian EMS partners to ensure scale and quality for deployments in both domestic and global markets.

articles.title: VC firm Andreessen Horowitz raises over $15 billion across multiple funds
articles.summary: The funds, which account for over 18% of all VC funds allocated in the US last year, will be invested in core technology platforms, including AI, cryptocurrency, and others. The geopolitical developments have caused the firm to change its investment strategy to invest in emerging technologies that can compete with China.

articles.title: TSMC fourth-quarter revenue jumps 20%, beats forecasts
articles.summary: TSMC reported a 20.45% increase in fourth-quarter revenue from a year earlier, ‌beating the market forecast, as demand for the company's products leapt in response to surging interest in AI applications.

articles.title: Physical AI dominates CES but humanity will still have to wait a while for humanoid servants
articles.summary: The annual event draws the biggest companies from the global tech and auto industries who this ⁠year underscored the shift from AI software to "physical AI" with robotics, humanoids and autonomous driving technology.

articles.title: China probes competition among food delivery platforms to curb price war
articles.summary: China will investigate cutthroat ‍competition among food delivery ​platforms operated by tech firms such as Meituan ⁠and Alibaba, aiming to rein in price wars that have eroded profits and contributed to deflationary pressures plaguing the economy.

articles.title: EU considers designating WhatsApp as very large platform, spokesperson says
articles.summary: The European Commission is considering recategorising Meta's WhatsApp to make ‌it more responsible ‌for tackling illegal and harmful ‌content, a spokesperson said on Friday.

articles.title: Meta strikes nuclear power agreements with three companies
articles.summary: Meta and other Big Tech companies want to secure long-term electricity supplies as artificial intelligence and data centers increase U.S. power demand ‌for the first time in two decades.

articles.title: Grok turns off AI image generation for non-payers after nudes backlash
articles.summary: Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok has turned off its image creation feature for non-paying users following backlash over its use to create sexualized deepfakes of women and children. Some users reportedly used Grok to generate pictures of women and children undressed, sometimes putting them in sexualized positions.

articles.title: SoftBank cuts Ola Electric stake to 13.5% amid continued investor sell-offs
articles.summary: SoftBank has cut its stake in Ola Electric to 13.53% after selling shares over recent months. The offloading comes as major investors trim stake amid regulatory pressure, rising competition and operational challenges. Ola’s market share and valuation also dropped sharply over the past year.

articles.title: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw discusses manufacturing of sovereign, high-end GPUs in India with Nvidia officials
articles.summary: India is stepping up plans to build its own graphics processors after talks between minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Nvidia executives. The discussions covered sovereign GPUs and local manufacturing of advanced AI devices. The government is also expanding subsidised access to GPUs to boost domestic AI development.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI quarterly net loss widens to $1.46 billion: Bloomberg
articles.summary: Elon Musk’s AI firm xAI posted a net loss of $1.46 billion for the September quarter, despite revenue almost doubling to $107 million, according to a report by Bloomberg. However, when contacted ‌by ‍Reuters for comment, xAI ‍replied with the message, "Legacy Media Lies." This comes as xAI announced a $20 billion funding round to expand its AI capabilities.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI to build $20 billion data centre in Mississippi
articles.summary: Elon Musk’s xAI plans to invest $20 billion in a vast data centre in Southaven, Mississippi, the state’s biggest-ever private project. The site will host "the world's largest supercomputer" with 2 gigawatts of computing power. The announcement comes as xAI faces scrutiny over its data centre projects in the Memphis area.

articles.title: TikTok picked by FIFA as video content partner at 2026 World Cup
articles.summary: FIFA has named TikTok its first preferred social media video platform at the men’s World Cup. Creators will gain special access and limited match content at the 2026 tournament. This partnership will continue through the end of 2026. FIFA said that the deal builds on FIFA and TikTok’s collaboration for the 2023 Women’s World Cup, which generated tens of billions of views.

articles.title: Apple Card switches hands but no immediate changes for users
articles.summary: Apple has confirmed JPMorgan will become the new issuer of the Apple Card, replacing Goldman Sachs, with no changes for customers. Rewards, savings features and Mastercard access will stay the same during the transition. The deal, closing in about two years, solidifies JPMorgan’s leading position in the US credit card market.

articles.title: EU antitrust regulators to decide on Google's Wiz deal by February 10
articles.summary: EU antitrust officials will decide by February 10 on Google owner Alphabet’s planned $32 billion purchase of cybersecurity firm Wiz. Announced last March, the acquisition secured the US green light in November last year. Tech ‍deals have in recent years faced ‌intense regulatory scrutiny on concerns that dominant companies may further boost their market power.

articles.title: Exclusive: Razorpay invites banker pitches for IPO; targets Rs 4,500 crore fundraise
articles.summary: Razorpay has begun formal preparations for a stock market debut, inviting merchant bankers to pitch for its IPO mandate, people familiar with the matter told ET. The digital payments firm is looking to raise up to Rs 4,500 in fresh capital.

articles.title: China is investigating Meta's latest AI acquisition
articles.summary: China is investigating whether Meta's acquisition of the artificial intelligence startup Manus violated its laws on technology exports and outbound investment. Those rules say that the Chinese government must approve the export of certain technologies, including interactive AI systems.

articles.title: Humanoid robots go for knockout in high-tech Vegas fight night
articles.summary: At a CES-adjacent event in Las Vegas, humanoid robots battled in an Ultimate Fighting Robot match at BattleBots Arena. Controlled by human pilots, the MMA-style fights aim to boost entertainment, attract fans to humanoid robotics, and collect movement data for research and development.

articles.title: Rapid digitalisation of banks reshaping financial risks, requires supervisors to fundamentally rethink: RBI DG
articles.summary: Speaking at the Third Annual Global Conference of the College of Supervisors in Mumbai, RBI Deputy Governor Swaminathan J said that traditional indicators such as capital adequacy and liquidity are no longer sufficient to assess the health of banks in a technology-driven environment.

articles.title: BMI forecasts 7% growth for India in FY27
articles.summary: India's economy is set for strong growth. BMI forecasts 7.4 per cent expansion for the current fiscal year and 7 per cent for FY27. Favourable policies and recent reforms are expected to boost investment and consumption. This positive outlook is supported by strong GDP estimates and rising exports. The foundation for continued economic progress is firmly in place.

articles.title: India’s retail inflation quickens for second straight month to 1.33% in December
articles.summary: India's retail inflation rose to 1.33% in December 2025, driven by increased costs in personal care, vegetables, meat, fish, eggs, spices, and pulses. Despite this uptick, inflation remained below the RBI's 4% target for the eleventh consecutive month. Food prices saw a reduced decline, with vegetable deflation easing.

articles.title: Growing inequality is the top economic concern for youth worldwide: WEF survey
articles.summary: A new World Economic Forum survey reveals that global youth identify growing inequality as their top economic concern. Many are also eager to enter politics rather than just critique, with over a third considering running for office. Climate change remains a defining global worry, even amidst personal financial anxieties.

articles.title: Donald Trump tries to break the Fed. What the clash means for India
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell revealed the Justice Department served subpoenas threatening criminal indictment over his Senate testimony, which he calls a "pretext" to pressure the Fed on interest rates. President Trump denied knowledge but criticized Powell, escalating a conflict over central bank independence and monetary policy.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Trump tariffs or not, trade power should stay with India
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: A 1985 Plaza Accord saw global powers coordinate to devalue the dollar, impacting Japan severely. Today, similar economic conditions and Donald Trump's protectionist policies are reshaping global trade. India, historically less integrated, may find an unexpected advantage in this shift towards self-sufficiency, potentially mitigating direct trade shocks.

articles.title: 'Protectionism hurts us both': Merz pushes for deeper India-Germany security ties as trade tops $50 billion
articles.summary: During his landmark trip to India, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz engaged in productive discussions with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The trade relationship has soared, surpassing fifty billion dollars, as both leaders sealed pivotal agreements focused on technology, defense, and renewable energy sources. Together, they tackled pressing global challenges and emphasised the importance of fortifying their security collaboration.

articles.title: Trump, Modi are ‘real friends’, says US ambassador Gor as India-US gear up for January 13 trade talks
articles.summary: With the inauguration of US Ambassador Sergio Gor in New Delhi, a new chapter in India-US relations begins. His mission highlights the deep-rooted friendship shared by both nations. Ongoing trade dialogues promise fruitful outcomes, with the next round of negotiations set to occur shortly.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Sitharaman & Co will be counting every rupee on the road to Viksit Bharat 2047
articles.summary: Budget 2026 approaches with India's fiscal calculations under scrutiny as tax collections have slowed, impacting government finances. The Finance Minister faces the challenge of maintaining fiscal consolidation amidst these pressures. Balancing growth with discipline will be key. Non-tax revenues and spending discipline are crucial. Market borrowing tolerance is also a significant consideration.

articles.title: Acquisition financing by Indian banks to sanctions risk, 2026 set to be a learning year for India Inc
articles.summary: In 2026, Indian enterprises are bracing for a transformative regulatory landscape, emphasizing toughness and adherence. Financial institutions are now empowered to support acquisitions, while private equity blossoms with the rise of secondary funds. However, the looming threat of sanctions remains a critical concern.

articles.title: Europe fills diplomatic agenda for India this week
articles.summary: Europe takes center stage in Indian diplomacy this week. German Chancellor Friedrich Merz visits Monday, seeking trade expansion before the EU free trade agreement. France's Emmanuel Bonne arrives Monday and Tuesday, preparing for President Macron's February trip. Poland's foreign minister Radosław Sikorski follows. Prime Minister Modi meets Merz in Ahmedabad to boost cooperation.

articles.title: Budget 2026: As economy holds firm, India Inc urges focus on growth, capex and private investment
articles.summary: Businesses in India are urging the government to prioritize economic growth in the upcoming budget. They are calling for more reforms and increased government spending on infrastructure. Incentives for private investment and privatization are also key demands. Support for exporters facing challenges from US tariffs is crucial. The budget is expected to outline the path for future economic expansion.

articles.title: Credit demand zooms as policy eases, outstanding bank credit crossed Rs 200 lakh cr for the first time on Dec 31, 2025
articles.summary: India's credit demand is surging. Lower taxes and supportive monetary policy are fueling investment. Outstanding bank credit has crossed a major milestone. This growth surpasses projections, indicating a strong economic rebound. Auto loans, small and mid-sized companies, and home loans are key drivers. Investment intentions are translating into spending, creating a positive environment.

articles.title: Budget 2026: CII seeks rolling, 3-year pipeline for privatisation
articles.summary: Budget FY26 expectations: The Confederation of Indian Industry suggests a three-year plan for selling stakes in government companies. This strategy aims to speed up privatisation. The industry body estimates a significant amount could be raised to fuel development. The proposal includes gauging investor interest first and then prioritising companies.

articles.title: State capex loans cross 56% of FY26 target by Jan 5; Centre aims for full utilisation
articles.summary: The Centre has released over ₹83,000 crore to states for capital investment. This is part of the special assistance scheme for capital investment. The government is confident of fully utilizing the allocation by the fiscal year end. The scheme provides interest-free loans to states for capital expenditure.

articles.title: Spain, Germany, Belgium, Poland emerging as key export destinations for India within EU
articles.summary: India's exports to European Union are showing strong growth. Spain is a standout market with significant export increases. Germany continues to be a stable destination for Indian products. Belgium and Poland also show positive export trends. These developments are occurring as India and the EU negotiate a free trade agreement, promising further bilateral trade growth.

articles.title: Explainer: Simplified Income Tax Act, 2025, to come into force from April 1
articles.summary: A new Income Tax Act, 2025, will replace the 1961 law on April 1, simplifying direct tax legislation and reducing its volume by 50%. The revenue-neutral act eliminates the distinction between assessment and previous years, introducing a single 'tax year' framework. Budget 2026-27 changes will be incorporated.

articles.title: Budget 2026-27: In the AI race, India can't afford to jog
articles.summary: India's digital sector is emerging as a crucial "power-lifter" amidst global economic realignments, strengthening domestic resilience and expanding its international footprint. With significant investments in infrastructure and deep technology, India is poised to convert its digital scale into sustained leadership, leveraging its complex ecosystem for AI innovation and securing infrastructure sovereignty.

articles.title: India eyes new markets with US trade deal limbo
articles.summary: India is aggressively seeking trade deals to open markets for exporters and soften the blow of steep US tariffs, as efforts to secure an agreement with Washington remain elusive. And while a free trade agreement (FTA) with New Zealand added little to Indian export growth, it secured $20 billion in foreign investment, increased visa access and showed Washington that New Delhi is willing to compromise.

articles.title: Ashwini Vaishnaw likely to attend US critical minerals meet amid China’s supply-chain weaponisation
articles.summary: India is set to participate in a key US-organized meet on critical minerals, with Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw likely to represent the nation. This engagement signals a broader US effort to diversify supply chains away from China's dominance. India will also join the US-led Pax Silica initiative ahead of its AI summit.

articles.title: Budget 2026: States seek higher capex aid, GST loss compensation in pre-Budget talks with Sitharaman
articles.summary: States met with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman ahead of the FY27 budget. They asked for more special assistance for capital investments and help with GST revenue losses. Increased funding for urban and rural schemes was also requested. Support for housing programs and disaster management was highlighted. The minister urged states to undertake reforms for India's developed nation goal by 2047.

articles.title: India, EU FTA talks: ministers say good progress made, full steam in coming days
articles.summary: India and the European Union are moving closer to a free trade agreement. Discussions in Brussels showed good progress with fewer issues remaining. Both sides are committed to a fair and ambitious deal. Negotiations are speeding up to finalize the pact soon. This agreement is crucial for economic ties between India and the EU.

articles.title: India’s record rice crop is set to deepen slide in global prices
articles.summary: India's record rice harvest is flooding the global market, pressuring prices as demand weakens and key buyers impose stricter import rules. Farmers may face significant rate cuts to compete with rivals like Thailand and Vietnam. Analysts predict a potential drop of $15 to $25 per ton by spring due to a lack of immediate African and Middle Eastern interest.

articles.title: India's 2025 rice exports surge to near record as curbs lifted
articles.summary: India’s rice exports rose 19.4% last year to 21.55 million tonnes, the second-highest level on record, after the government lifted all export curbs. Officials said shipments recovered quickly from March as supplies improved on record production and the last restrictions imposed in 2022–23 were removed.

articles.title: Telangana govt to promote $3 trillion economy goal at WEF Davos 2026
articles.summary: Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy said the state will actively promote its Telangana Rising 2047 vision and aim for a $3 trillion economy at the World Economic Forum in Davos 2026. The delegation will showcase the state’s transformative growth plans, revisit past investment commitments, and highlight opportunities in innovation, technology, and inclusive development.

articles.title: PM Modi made eight calls in 2025: India rejects US claim on trade deal delay
articles.summary: Modi and Trump have spoken on the phone “on eight occasions during 2025, covering different aspects of our wide-ranging partnership”, external affairs ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said on Friday. Lutnick had said that India was given “three Fridays” to clinch a trade deal with Washington last year and that Modi had to call Trump to close it.

articles.title: RBI trims US treasury holding to below $200 bn amid gold rush
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has reduced its holdings in US Treasuries. This strategic move sees the central bank increasing its gold reserves. The shift aims to diversify foreign exchange reserves. This diversification is a response to global economic uncertainties. India joins other nations in this trend. The RBI's forex reserves remain stable overall.

articles.title: Budget 2026: India may peg nominal growth for FY27 at 10%
articles.summary: Union Budget of India: India's upcoming budget may target a nominal growth rate of around 10 percent. This is an increase from the estimated 8 percent for the current fiscal year. Economic growth is expected to remain strong. Inflation is also projected to rise in the next fiscal year due to base effects.

articles.title: Financial Services secretary flags digital risks, says AI key to tackling mule accounts
articles.summary: The central bank has introduced initiatives such as MuleHunter.ai to combat mule accounts used for fraudulent transactions. The AI tool delivers high accuracy and precision with significantly low false-positive rates and is currently deployed across 20 commercial banks.

articles.title: In a fragmenting world, India backs rules-based global economic system, says Shaktikanta Das
articles.summary: Delivering the first Bibek Debroy Memorial Lecture on the them Indian Economy: A Story of Rising Credibility, Shaktikanta Das, principal secretary 2 to prime minister, said the global economy is at an inflection point, with geopolitical rivalries, protectionist trade policies and weakening multilateral institutions reshaping cross-border commerce and investment flows.

articles.title: Budget Session 2026 to start from January 28, confirms Kiren Rijiju; Budget presentation likely on Feb 1
articles.summary: Budget Session will start on 28 January 2026 and continue till 2 April 2026. President Droupadi Murmu has approved the summoning of Parliament for the Budget Session 2026 and the Union Budget is likely be presented on February 1, a Sunday, followed by a recess for committee examinations. The session will reconvene on March 9.

articles.title: RBI deputy governor pitches for collaboration to deal with frauds
articles.summary: T Rabi Sankar said collaboration between banks and central bank owned Reserve Bank Innovation Hub (RBIH) will both quicken and enhance the capability of these risk mechanisms.

articles.title: Ways and Means Advances limit for Delhi govt fixed at Rs 890 cr: RBI
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has set the Ways and Means Advances limit for the Delhi government at Rs 890 crore. This move will assist the city government in managing temporary gaps between its income and expenses. The central bank will also conduct the Delhi government's general banking business starting January 09, 2026.

articles.title: Budget 2026: PHDCCI recommends reform agenda as spotlight falls on banks, MSMEs
articles.summary: Budget 2026: India's industry body PHDCCI anticipates new government reforms. These include deeper divestment and privatization of public sector enterprises. The aim is to boost corporate activity and protect the economy from export uncertainty. The upcoming budget may clarify the future of public sector banks. Reforms are also expected to support MSMEs and the financial sector.

articles.title: India’s forex reserves fall $9.8 billion to $686.8 billion in first week of 2026
articles.summary: India's foreign exchange reserves saw a significant drop of $9.809 billion. Reserves stood at $686.801 billion in the week ending January 02, 2026. This follows a rise in the previous week. Foreign currency assets and gold reserves also decreased. The Reserve Bank of India monitors these movements closely.

articles.title: Digital frauds: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra calls for collaboration between regulator, regulated to protect customers
articles.summary: While telling banks and other regulated entities to continue to improve their tools, techniques and processes in preventing and tackling digital frauds, Malhotra urged for collaborations in building analytics and tools to detect mule accounts and suspicious transactions timely and pre-emptively.

articles.title: India to focus on skilled jobs, employment quality to achieve inclusive growth: EAC-PM chief S Mahendra Dev
articles.summary: India is shifting its focus towards generating skilled employment and improving job quality, an essential step for sustainable economic development. With a target growth rate of 7.7 percent from 2022-23 to 2025-26, the nation envisions a future where investments, domestic savings, and exports flourish. Emphasizing the manufacturing sector is seen as key to creating more labor-intensive job opportunities.

articles.title: ‘PM Modi and Trump have spoken eight times in 2025’: India rejects Lutnick’s claim that stalled trade talks were due to lack of outreach
articles.summary: India has firmly countered the statements made by US Commerce Secretary Lutnick regarding stalled trade discussions. Officials affirmed that Prime Minister Modi and President Trump are in regular communication, with the Ministry of External Affairs underscoring ongoing high-level interactions.

articles.title: India’s growth miracle in danger? Former CEA warns of tariffs, Chinese imports, and fiscal risks
articles.summary: India's economic landscape is navigating turbulent waters, cautions former Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Subramanian. He highlights the looming threats posed by US tariffs and competitive pressures from Chinese exports. Moreover, he notes the challenges of domestic fiscal health in this climate.

articles.title: Reduce leverage, shift to largecaps as Nifty tests 25,500; SBI, Varun Beverages preferred: CA Rudramurthy
articles.summary: Markets have broken key short-term supports as the Nifty struggles near 25,500, warns CA Rudramurthy of Vachana Investments. He advises investors to cut leverage, shift to low-beta largecaps and focus on capital protection amid sharp midcap and smallcap losses. He names SBI, Varun Beverages and Indus Towers as stocks showing relative strength.

articles.title: BofA takes a measured view on Meesho’s next phase, starts coverage with 'neutral' rating; stock sheds 5%
articles.summary: BofA Securities has initiated coverage on newly listed Meesho with a Neutral rating and a Rs 190 target, citing advertising and logistics as key monetisation drivers. The brokerage remains cautious on valuation after the post-IPO rally. Meesho shares fell 5% on Monday but still trade well above their IPO price.

articles.title: Rupee ends flat, caught between softer dollar and corporate hedging
articles.summary: The Indian rupee closed nearly ‍flat on Monday, wedged ​between a broadly weaker dollar and steady hedging demand from ⁠domestic firms, while optimism over U.S.-India trade talks offered some support to market sentiment. The rupee closed at 90.1525 per dollar, little changed from 90.1625 in the previous session.

articles.title: TCS declares Rs 57 dividend, including Rs 46 special payout. Check record date and other details
articles.summary: TCS declared a Rs 57 per share dividend, including a Rs 46 special payout, supported by strong cash flows. Despite modest revenue growth and lower profit, stable margins and rising AI-led services continue to underpin long-term strategy.

articles.title: FIIs trimmed stakes in 12 small-cap stocks for two consecutive quarters, shares slide up to 45%
Wall Street skeptical Trump's proposed credit card rate cap will advance
articles.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump's proposal to cap credit card interest ‍rates at 10% has grabbed headlines ​but would require legislation and has slim odds of passing, ⁠Wall Street analysts said.

articles.title: Market Wrap: Sensex adds 302 pts, Nifty above 25,750 as D-St ends 5-day losing run, rebounding on US trade deal hopes
articles.summary: Indian equities closed higher Monday, with the Sensex and Nifty snapping a five-session losing streak after a late-afternoon rebound, as investors took comfort from signs of renewed engagement between New Delhi and Washington on trade.

articles.title: JPMorgan forecasts 2027 Fed hike; Barclays, Goldman postpone rate cut calls
articles.summary: J.P. Morgan predicts the U.S. Federal Reserve's next move will be a rate hike in 2027, while Barclays and Goldman Sachs joined Morgan Stanley in postponing rate ‌cut calls to mid-2026 ‌as data suggested that the labor market was not rapidly deteriorating.

articles.title: Dolly Khanna trims stake in smallcaps GHCL and Prakash Industries in December quarter. How have stocks performed?
articles.summary: Ace investor Dolly Khanna trimmed stakes in smallcaps GHCL and Prakash Industries in Q3FY26 after sustained underperformance, as both stocks remain below key moving averages, signalling caution amid weak price trends and continued market volatility.

articles.title: Vodafone Idea AGR relief offers breathing room but shareholders still await clarity
articles.summary: Vodafone Idea gains four-year AGR payment relief, easing short-term cash stress. Analysts warn fundamentals remain weak, with heavy debt, ongoing losses, delayed 5G rollout, and uncertain equity infusion, limiting earnings visibility and leaving shareholders exposed to dilution and volatility risk.

articles.title: Sensex recovers by over 1000 points from day's low. Did a Trump signal via U.S. envoy Sergio Gor just calm markets?
articles.summary: Indian stock markets staged a sharp intraday rebound after early losses, buoyed by reassuring comments from newly appointed U.S. Ambassador to India Sergio Gor on India–U.S. trade ties. The Sensex and Nifty recovered swiftly from steep morning declines.

articles.title: European shares slip as banks slide on Trump's credit card fee cap plan
articles.summary: European shares dipped on Monday as tensions between the U.S. administration and Federal ‌Reserve Chair ‌Jerome Powell turned global markets cautious, and President Donald Trump's ‌call for a one-year cap on credit card interest rates weighed on banks.

articles.title: Bhumika Realty raises Rs 170 cr to fund project in Faridabad
articles.summary: Bhumika Realty has raised Rs 170 crore from a real estate credit platform of Aditya Birla Sun Life AMC and BGO to fund its new mixed-use project in Faridabad.

articles.title: German bond yields edge lower after Trump team attacks Powell
articles.summary: German government bond yields edged lower in early trading on Monday, ‍in contrast with U.S. ​Treasury yields, which rose after the Trump administration threatened Chair Jerome ⁠Powell with a criminal indictment, again unnerving investors over the independence of the world's most powerful central bank.

articles.title: Swiggy sees FII, mutual fund buying for third consecutive quarter. Time to buy the dip?
articles.summary: Swiggy has seen consistent stake increases from FIIs and mutual funds for the third straight quarter, signalling institutional confidence despite a sharp stock correction. Analysts remain bullish, while technical indicators suggest the stock may be oversold in the short term.

articles.title: IT earnings unlikely to surprise; management commentary in focus: Pankaj Pandey
articles.summary: Investors can find opportunities in specific sectors even as markets consolidate. Life insurance growth is improving but faces margin pressures. The IT sector expects modest growth, with management commentary being key. Real estate, despite recent underperformance, offers selective prospects. Companies with strong consumption and leasing are favored.

articles.title: NSE targets filing IPO documents by end of March: Report
articles.summary: National Stock Exchange of India Ltd (NSE), the country's largest exchange, ‍plans to file its draft prospectus ​for its long awaited public listing by the end of March, ⁠according to two people familiar with the matter.

articles.title: TCS Q3 Results FY26 Live Updates: Cons PAT falls 14% YoY. Board declares interim dividend of Rs 11/share; special dividend of Rs 46/share
Selective discretionary spending, wage hikes to shape IT Q3: Sushovan Nayak
articles.summary: Investors are watching IT sector earnings closely. TCS and HCL Tech are expected to show steady revenue growth. Deal momentum and AI integration will be key. Margins may face pressure from wage hikes. Currency movements could offer some support. The focus is on resilience rather than acceleration in this earnings season.

articles.title: Fed turning dovish despite inflation risks; AI boom real but profits uncertain: Raghuram Rajan
articles.summary: Former RBI governor Raghuram Rajan says the US Federal Reserve is turning dovish despite inflation staying above target, raising risks of excess credit growth. He calls the AI boom real but warns profits may take time to materialise, says tariffs hurt consumers, and flags deep structural problems in China’s growth model that could fuel global trade tensions.

articles.title: Reliance Industries shares rebound 2.2% from day's low, still down 5% in 2026. Should you buy before Q3 results on Friday?
articles.summary: Reliance Industries' shares have seen a dip, but analysts remain optimistic ahead of its Q3FY26 results. Goldman Sachs and Nomura maintain 'Buy' ratings, citing strong refining fundamentals and steady telecom growth to offset retail slowdown. Experts believe recent concerns are overblown, projecting significant upside.

articles.title: Andrew Freris on political pressure on the Fed, soaring gold and where to invest in a ‘Messy’ world
articles.summary: Andrew Freris warns of political interference in U.S. institutions and questions the commodity rally, advising investors against complacency in American equities. He highlights underperformance in U.S. markets and suggests defense sector opportunities outside the United States as a profitable investment strategy.

articles.title: Bitcoin rebounds towards $92,000 as traders turn cautious ahead of US inflation data
articles.summary: Bitcoin rebounded towards $92,000 as traders turned cautious ahead of key US inflation data. Gains across major cryptocurrencies reflect tentative optimism, while analysts say sustained moves above resistance levels could signal a broader recovery in the crypto market.

articles.title: Amagi Media Labs IPO opens tomorrow: GMP at 10%, check price band and key details
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs’ Rs 1,789 crore IPO opens on January 13, with a 10% grey market premium indicating strong demand. The issue comprises a fresh issue and OFS, with listing expected on January 21 on the BSE and NSE.

articles.title: Silver bulls now eyeing Rs 3 lakh milestone. Should you buy or wait for dip?
articles.summary: Silver prices surged to fresh lifetime highs on the MCX, with the March 2026 contract peaking around ₹2.63 lakh per kg before settling slightly lower, marking a strong daily gain. The rally reflects heightened safe‑haven demand amid geopolitical uncertainty, a weak US dollar and global volatility, and robust industrial interest in the metal.

articles.title: ‘Not too late to buy,’ says Rich Dad Poor Dad author Robert Kiyosaki as silver crosses $80
articles.summary: Robert Kiyosaki, author of 'Rich Dad Poor Dad,' remains bullish on silver, even as prices soar past $80 an ounce. He advises investors against missing out, planning to buy more until it reaches $100. Kiyosaki cautions against greed, emphasizing disciplined profit-taking while highlighting silver's potential as a hedge against inflation and currency debasement.

articles.title: Explained: Why crypto users in India must now submit live selfies and location details
articles.summary: India’s Financial Intelligence Unit has tightened KYC and AML norms for crypto platforms, mandating live selfie verification, geo-location checks and enhanced due diligence to curb money laundering and illicit transactions, significantly raising compliance requirements for exchanges and users.

articles.title: Hindustan Zinc shares rise 3% as silver hits fresh record high over $83. What should investors do?
articles.summary: Hindustan Zinc shares surged on Monday, mirroring a significant jump in silver prices driven by global tensions and Federal Reserve concerns. The company, a major silver producer, is benefiting from rising metal prices and improved cost efficiency. Analysts remain optimistic, citing a constructive technical outlook and strong earnings potential, with a target price suggesting further upside.

articles.title: India bonds rise as states cut supply in weekly auction
articles.summary: Indian government bonds saw gains early Monday. Traders welcomed a lower-than-expected supply in this week's state debt sale. This eased fears of a supply glut. States will raise less than previously scheduled. This offers near-term relief on supply. Longer-duration overnight index swap rates also fell. This tracked lower US Treasury and Indian government bond yields.

articles.title: Manappuram Finance stock rises 4% following clarification on Bain Capital deal reports
articles.summary: Manappuram Finance shares rose nearly 4% after the company clarified that its proposed Bain Capital deal is progressing as planned, with most RBI approvals already in place and final regulatory clearance awaited, easing investor concerns.

articles.title: Q3 likely to be modest for IT, commentary more crucial than numbers: Sandip Agarwal
articles.summary: India's IT sector faces a modest December quarter. Investors should focus on management outlook rather than just numbers. Deal wins are expected to be around one. Smaller companies are now competing for deals. Artificial intelligence will support margins, not growth. Investors should prefer smaller IT firms and watch valuations closely.

articles.title: Mortgage bonds return to spotlight as White House targets housing relief
articles.summary: The Trump administration is set to buy mortgage-backed securities. This move aims to counter the Federal Reserve's reduction of its bond holdings. The goal is to stabilize the mortgage market. The Federal Housing Finance Agency will purchase bonds from Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac. This initiative seeks to ease housing affordability pressures.

articles.title: CPI, Chips and Court Rulings: What could move US markets this week
articles.summary: Global markets return to action as investors track US inflation data, AI-driven chip earnings, court rulings on tariffs and major bank results. Geopolitical tensions and shifting rate expectations are set to shape sentiment across equities, currencies and bonds this week.

articles.title: IEX shares extend slide to 35% from peak amid market coupling overhang: Buy or avoid?
articles.summary: Indian Energy Exchange (IEX) shares have plummeted 35% from their peak, driven by regulatory uncertainty surrounding the market coupling order. Experts advise caution, citing weak technicals and potential dilution of IEX's market dominance, though some see value if a favorable outcome is reached.

articles.title: IEX shares rebound 3%, snap 2-day fall. Should investors buy, sell or hold?
articles.summary: Indian Energy Exchange shares saw a jump on January 12, recovering from a recent dip. The company is challenging a regulatory order on market coupling. Analysts offer divided opinions, with some seeing upside potential while others warn of regulatory risks. The exchange reported strong electricity traded volumes for the third quarter of FY26, with lower power prices observed.

articles.title: Dharmesh Kant on 3 sectors offering buy-on-dips opportunities
articles.summary: Indian stock markets are consolidating. Investors are assessing earnings against current uncertainties. Experts see opportunities in financial services, defence, and metals. These sectors offer potential for growth. Automobiles are seen as fully priced. Investors are advised to be selective. Focus remains on large-cap stocks until the budget.

articles.title: D-St investors lose Rs 18.5 lakh crore in 6 days as Sensex slumps 2,900 pts, Nifty sinks 3%. What’s driving the selloff?
articles.summary: Stock Market Crash: Indian equities experienced a significant slump on Monday, with the Sensex and Nifty extending their selloff and erasing nearly Rs 18.5 lakh crore in market value. Investor unease stems from uncertainty surrounding U.S. tariff policy and global geopolitical events, prolonging a policy overhang and spiking the India VIX.

articles.title: Fed-White House rift rattles markets as Powell flags political pressure
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell revealed the White House threatened him with a criminal indictment to pressure the central bank into cutting interest rates. This unprecedented confrontation has rattled financial markets, weakening the US dollar and raising concerns about the Fed's independence. Analysts believe the move signals a broader administration effort to undermine institutions.

articles.title: Sensex suffers the worst start to a year in a decade. What this selloff means for investors?
articles.summary: India's equity markets experienced their worst start to a year in a decade as the BSE Sensex fell 1.93% in the first ten days of 2026. Geopolitical tensions, trade deal uncertainties, and sustained foreign institutional investor selling contributed to a broad-based sell-off, particularly impacting cyclical sectors. Analysts advise caution, focusing on quality large-cap stocks amidst expected continued volatility.

articles.title: At record high! Gold prices jump Rs 2,000, silver rallies Rs 10,000: What's fuelling the surge?
articles.summary: Gold and silver surged to record highs as geopolitical tensions, US policy uncertainty and expectations of rate cuts drove safe-haven demand. Analysts flag continued volatility, key support levels and trading opportunities amid heightened global and domestic market anxiety.

articles.title: Hyundai Motor India shares plunge 20% from all-time peak. Will Q3 help turn the tide?
articles.summary: Hyundai Motor India shares are down 20% from peak as GST 2.0 benefits remain limited and margin pressures persist. Analysts see Q3 revenue growth support from exports, but caution on demand, valuation and new plant-related costs.

articles.title: UK regulator launches investigation into X over Grok sexualised imagery
articles.summary: Britain’s media regulator Ofcom has opened an investigation into Elon Musk’s X over alleged misuse of its Grok AI chatbot to generate sexual deepfakes. The probe follows political pressure after Prime Minister Keir Starmer condemned the content as unlawful. Ofcom will assess whether X failed to protect UK users, particularly children, from illegal material.

articles.title: ETtech Explainer: What OpenAI’s new ‘health’ feature means for its second-largest user market, India
articles.summary: The feature is being presented as a helper, not a medical expert. OpenAI says it is meant to assist users in understanding reports, preparing questions for doctors, and keeping track of overall wellbeing, rather than offering diagnoses or treatment.

articles.title: Dharana Capital raises $250 million for India-focussed fund
articles.summary: With the new fund, its total assets under management are at $450 million. It said that its limited partner (LP) base includes US university endowments, healthcare companies and other non-profit organisations.

articles.title: Malaysia, Indonesia become first to block Musk's Grok over AI deepfakes
articles.summary: The moves reflect growing global concern over generative AI tools that can produce realistic images, sound and text, while existing safeguards fail to prevent their abuse. The Grok chatbot, which is accessed through Musk's social media platform X, has been criticised for generating manipulated images, including depictions of women in bikinis or sexually explicit poses, as well as images involving children.

articles.title: Omnipresent humanoid robots, AI innovations at CES 2026 preview world of future
articles.summary: CES 2026, the most powerful tech event in the world, presented by the Consumer Technology Association (CTA), was held across multiple sprawling venues in Las Vegas from January 6-9. The event saw global companies, startups, industry executives and government leaders to "experience the next-generation of tech that will solve global challenges."

articles.title: Security startup Torq raises cash at $1.2 billion valuation
articles.summary: Torq, which is based in Tel Aviv, offers what it says is an autonomous security operations platform designed from the ground up with artificial intelligence. Torq can automate repetitive work using AI agents, like wading through huge volumes of security alerts. That allows employees to focus on more complex, and potentially dangerous, issues.

articles.title: Google teams up with Walmart and other retailers to enable shopping within Gemini AI chatbot
articles.summary: An instant checkout function will allow customers to make purchases from some businesses and through a range of payment providers without leaving the Gemini chat they used to find products, according to Walmart and Google.

articles.title: Behind hyper-realistic AI content flooding all social media feeds
articles.summary: Social media feeds are filling with lifelike videos and images made entirely by AI, often mistaken for real events or people. Experts say platforms promote such content because it drives attention and revenue. However, poor detection, weak regulation and misuse risks, from fraud to misinformation, are raising serious trust and safety concerns.

articles.title: Google teams up with Walmart, other retailers to enable shopping within Gemini AI chatbot
articles.summary: Google is enhancing its Gemini AI chatbot with shopping features, partnering with Walmart, Shopify and Wayfair to enable instant purchases without leaving the app. Recommendations can be personalised based on past purchases, linking to existing carts. OpenAI and Walmart announced a similar deal in October, saying the partnership would allow ChatGPT members to use an instant checkout feature to shop for nearly everything available on Walmart's website except for fresh food.

articles.title: India should prioritise Indic AI models instead of foundational ones: OpenAI researcher
articles.summary: Sushant Sachdeva urged India to focus on AI models for local languages rather than competing with the US and China on large foundation models. He said India can use existing public models to serve its linguistically diverse population. His remarks come as the government and startups boost efforts in homegrown AI development.

articles.title: xAI locked out of Claude as Anthropic enforces competitor rules
articles.summary: Anthropic has blocked xAI from using its Claude AI models after xAI accessed them through the Cursor coding tool, citing rules against aiding competitors. xAI cofounder Tony Wu said this will slow productivity but push them to build their own tools. This comes just as Elon Musk announced that X’s recommendation algorithm will be open-sourced soon.

articles.title: Malaysia suspends access to Musk's Grok AI
articles.summary: Malaysia has blocked access to Elon Musk’s Grok chatbot after it was widely misused to create pornographic and abusive images. Regulators said safeguards were weak, despite earlier warnings, and cited sexualised content involving women and children. Access will return only after changes are made, following similar action by Indonesia earlier.

articles.title: AI pendants back in vogue at tech show after early setback
articles.summary: Pendants and brooches packed with artificial intelligence abounded at the Consumer Electronics show, using cameras and microphones to watch and listen through the day like a vigilant personal assistant. Nonetheless, at the CES show in Las Vegas, gadget makers have pitched AI pendants as note-takers or ways to remember beautiful or important moments of each day.

articles.title: Indian IT leaders focus on agentic AI for growth, majority of them find AI augmenting talent: Survey
articles.summary: Indian IT leaders are embracing agentic AI for business growth. This autonomous AI technology is a top priority, unlike in Western markets. Indian enterprises are preparing for AI-led business models. AI initiatives are enhancing skills and speed, augmenting talent. New roles are emerging from human-AI collaboration. Indian leaders expect significant revenue uplift from AI within five years.

articles.title: AI toys look for bright side after troubled start
articles.summary: Toy makers at the Consumer Electronics Show were adamant about being careful to ensure that their fun creations infused with generative artificial intelligence don't turn naughty. Toy giant Mattel, meanwhile, made no mention of the report in mid-December when it postponed the release of its first toy developed in partnership with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI.

articles.title: China is closing in on US technology lead despite constraints, AI researchers say
articles.summary: China can narrow its technological gap with the US driven by growing risk-taking ‍and innovation, though the lack of ​advanced chipmaking tools is hobbling the sector, the country's leading artificial intelligence ⁠researchers said.

articles.title: India AI Mission fuels startup ecosystem, strengthens push to make India 'global AI producer': Experts
articles.summary: Industry leaders and startup ecosystem enablers have hailed the Government of India's ambitious India AI Mission, calling it a transformative step toward making India a global hub for artificial intelligence by the end of this decade.

articles.title: IndiaAI Mission fuels startup ecosystem, strengthens push to make India 'global AI producer': Experts
articles.summary: Industry leaders and startup ecosystem enablers have hailed the Government of India's ambitious IndiaAI Mission, calling it a transformative step toward making India a global hub for artificial intelligence by the end of this decade.

articles.title: PM Modi tells IndiaAI startups to showcase local AI use cases at February summit
articles.summary: The PM held a closed-door meeting at his residence on January 8 with about a dozen founders from the IndiaAI Mission cohort. Union IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and senior officials of MeitY also attended the meeting. Modi told the founders to develop safe and authenticated AI, prioritising trust, transparency, and watermarking in their models to build user confidence and comply with evolving regulations.

articles.title: Nine ITIs in Odisha to get AI labs: CM Mohan Charan Majhi
articles.summary: Odisha chief minister Mohan Charan Majhi on Friday said artificial intelligence (AI) laboratories are being set up in nine Industrial Training Institutes (ITIs) of the state.

articles.title: Brew, smell, and serve: AI steals the show at CES 2026

articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. Now, investors are constantly searching for a reliable crystal ball that accurately predicts the future. While no indicator is perfect, one has come closer than any other: The yield curve. A specific, peculiar behaviour of the yield curve, known as an inversion, has preceded most major economic recessions in the US. When this happens, it’s as if the bond market – often considered the “smart money” in the ro

articles.title: Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman's eight Budgets navigated India through economic slowdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic with a pragmatic approach. She balanced fiscal discipline with strategic capital expenditure and welfare support, laying the groundwork for India's 'Viksit Bharat' ambition. Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

articles.title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts

Again, however the indices move in the next couple of sessions, remember that a large majority of institutional investors will be back in office only by Monday or Tuesday. So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: One of America’s most successful experiments with Indians is coming to a shuddering halt

Highly skilled Indian immigrants, long seen as a success story, now face challenges. Visa policies and rhetoric are impacting their ability to work and live in the US. This shift questions America's welcoming image for global talent.

The nation experienced a shift towards conservatism and a rise in anti-India sentiment. Economic challenges persisted, with concerns over debt and corruption.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump

Key stocks like Jupiter Wagons and RVNL have seen substantial gains.

articles.title: Why active investing could outperform passive strategies in 2026
articles.summary: As 2026 approaches, experts suggest active, selective investing may outperform passive strategies amid wide dispersion in earnings and valuations. Largecaps remain strong, midcaps show steady growth, while smallcaps lag. Investors are advised to focus on bottom-up stock selection, thematic plays, and balanced allocation across equities, commodities, and debt.

While global markets face volatility, India's lack of an AI boom may position it as a favored diversification destination for cyclical exposure. Expect earnings-led returns rather than valuation rerating.

Prices have largely held up due to demand for premium homes, but investor interest has softened, and some projects are offering discounts. articles.summary: DRDO has successfully tested its indigenously developed Man Portable Anti-Tank Guided Missile with top attack capability against a moving target in Maharashtra.

articles.summary: Presented in Parliament a day before the Budget, the Economic Survey is best described as India’s economic report card and roadmap rolled into one. articles.title: Donald Trump denies role in DoJ's investigation into Fed chair Jerome Powell

articles.title: Shed colonial mindset, trust Indian capability: Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw to railway officials
articles.summary: Addressing senior officials at the Ati Vishisht Rail Seva Puraskar ceremony, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw laid out a reform-driven roadmap for Indian Railways, emphasising technology adoption, safety, advanced training and wider collaboration with startups to position the national transporter as a global benchmark by 2047.

articles.title: India confident of dealing with headwinds from ‘known, unknown sources’: Principal Secy to PM Shaktikanta Das

articles.title: India cuts US Treasury holdings by 21% in 2025, signals reserve diversification

He said any trade deal-led support may be temporary, with limited upside for the rupee. UBS remains more positive on the Chinese renminbi among Asian currencies.

articles.title: India’s consumption recovery: When Goldman Sachs expects demand to pick up
articles.summary: Santanu Sengupta, Chief India Economist at Goldman Sachs, said urban credit growth has already started to recover, helped by regulatory easing from the RBI..

articles.title: Why India’s credit system needs accountability in distribution
articles.summary: Loans represent some of the largest and longest tenure financial decisions made by households and MSMEs, yet those intermediating these decisions face no market wide requirements for training, testing or continuing education, notes Shachindra Nath, Founder & Managing Director, UGRO Capital.

articles.title: US Supreme court likely to rule on Trump tariffs today; What is at stake here?
articles.summary: While it is not guaranteed that the Supreme Court will issue its verdict, it has designated Friday as a “decision day” for releasing opinions, and many anticipate that the tariff case will be addressed.

articles.title: Global cooperation showing resilience despite geopolitical headwinds: WEF study
articles.summary: The barometer indicated that the overall level of cooperation has largely been unchanged in recent years, but the composition of cooperation appears to be evolving.

articles.title: Most of Wall Street drifts as defence companies rocket higher
articles.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 109 points, or 0.2 per cent, as of 9:35 am Eastern time, and the Nasdaq composite was 0.4 per cent lower.

For India, the evolving mix of discounted Russian barrels and softer heavy crude markets could translate into steadier feedstock costs and improved refining margins, even as geopolitical risks persist.

articles.title: Budget 2026: EY pitches TDS simplification for ease of doing business, seeks consolidation

Metals are expected to remain a dominant theme, while the government is likely to maintain its spending at 3% of GDP, with a potential focus on railways and defence in the upcoming budget.
